item.title: Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 - How to Level Scholarship
item.description:
Players have a lot of freedom when it comes to building Henry up in Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 . The skills you choose to improve can drastically affect how Henry interacts with the world, and one such skill involves Scholarship, which influences your character's worldly and academic knowledge.

A good education is rare in medieval Bohemia, and if Henry can prove himself to be a learned man, you can easily talk your way out of some of the more complicated quests, such as For Whom The Bell Tolls in KCD2 . Leveling up the Scholarship skill is a bit of a hassle though, so here's a guide to help with that.

Quick Links

  • How to Level Scholarship in KCD2
    • Speaking with Scholars
  • Where to Get Books in KCD2

How to Level Scholarship in KCD2

You can get XP for the Scholarship skill by learning new things. You can gain new knowledge by speaking with NPCs or learning books . A pop-up saying that Henry learned something new will appear on the upper-right of the screen when you successfully gain knowledge, and bit by bit, your Scholarship level will increase as long as you keep learning new things.

Speaking with Scholars

Other educated people are great sources of new knowledge. You can often learn a thing or two from scribes, noblemen, and other scholars in the world . Strike up a conversation and ask them questions, and you may pick up a new thing or two.

Learning about things like new locations, tidbits of history, or other facts that can be considered scholarly or academic will net you 6 XP. Using Scholarship dialogue choices will give you a bit of XP as well.

As a rule of thumb, if you're speaking to an expert, try to ask them questions to see if you can pick up some XP for Scholarship or other skills.

Where to Get Books in KCD2

Apart from randomly finding scholarly books in the world, you may also find some sold by scribes . There's one inside the town hall of Troskowitz. Picking up and reading a scholarly book will significantly increase your Scholarship skill's level as you flip through its pages. In general, you should be looking for books about philosophy and theology . Scholarship books include:

  • Teachings of Peter Waldo
  • Rare Book From Sedletz
  • Basics of Philosophy
  • Master's Studies I
  • Fragments From The Bible

Other books will also increase your Scholarship XP even if they aren't specifically meant for the Scholarship skill. Lore books, such as King Sigismund of Hungary will net you 22 Scholarship XP, while skill books any of the philosophy/theology books above or something like The Strength of the Knight I give about ~100 XP, depending on the level of the book.

When reading skill books, make sure to sit down and press the Study button prompt on the bottom-right side of the screen. For lore books, you only need to open them to gain XP.

item.title: Paradox Interactive Acquires Haemimont Games
item.description:
Summary

  • Paradox Interactive has acquired Haemimont Games, known for simulation and city-building titles like Surviving Mars.
  • The acquisition will not disrupt Haemimont Games' ongoing projects and will strengthen Paradox's creative potential.
  • Despite setbacks like shutting down Tectonic studio and issuing refunds, Paradox has a strong game catalog to build upon.

Swedish publisher Paradox Interactive has acquired developer Haemimont Games. Originally the video game division of Target Games, the Stockholm-based studio later became part of Paradox Entertainment before spinning off as an independent company in 2004. From its inception, one of Paradox Interactive’s key objectives was to establish itself as an AAA game studio, a feat it has since achieved with many of its game titles.

Paradox Interactive is best known for its grand strategy games, boasting a strong lineup of well-regarded titles such as Stellaris , Europa Universalis 4 , and Hearts of Iron 4 . The studio is also behind Crusader Kings 3 , which many fans consider to be one of the greatest kingdom building games ever made. However, Paradox’s portfolio extends beyond strategy, featuring popular simulation games like Cities: Skylines and action RPGs like Vampire: The Masquerade – Bloodlines 2 .

Paradox Interactive CEO Fredrik Wester announced on Twitter that Haemimont Games has joined the Paradox Studio Group and will become a wholly owned subsidiary. In his post, he praised the Bulgarian studio’s catalog of work, highlighted their past collaborations, and expressed excitement about the future projects that will emerge from the acquisition.

Paradox Interactive Purchases Haemimont Games

The purchase will keep Haemimont Games’ leadership intact and will not disrupt any of its ongoing projects. The Bulgarian studio specializes in simulation and city-building games, aligning well with Paradox’s portfolio. Surviving Mars , a very popular city-building simulation game, was developed by Haemimont Games and published by Paradox in 2018. Given their history of collaboration and shared focus on similar genres, the acquisition appears to be a natural fit.

In 2024, Paradox officially shut down its Tectonic studio, which had been developing the highly anticipated life simulation game Life by You . The company stated that the project, intended as a rival to EA’s The Sims , failed to meet expectations. The closure came shortly after another setback for Paradox, as it had to issue refunds for Cities: Skylines 2 DLC following a wave of negative reviews at launch. After the fiasco, the developer admitted that the DLC was not ready to be released.

Despite these road bumps, Paradox has a strong catalog of games to build upon as it moves forward. The acquisition brings in a talented team with extensive experience in similar genres, strengthening the company’s creative potential. For fans of both Paradox and Haemimont titles, the merger could pave the way for a new generation of immersive simulation and grand strategy games.

item.title: Pokemon TCG Pocket: The Magnezone & Darkrai ex Meta, Explained
item.description:
Quick Links

  • How the Magnezone-Darkrai ex Meta Works
  • The Best Magnezone & Darkrai ex Deck Shell
  • The Rise and Fall of Magnezone-Darkrai ex
  • The Future of Ability-Oriented Decks in Pokemon Pocket

When Pokemon Pocket 's Space-Time Smackdown set dropped, two Pokemon clearly stood out: Magnezone and Darkrai ex. One became a key piece for Lightning decks, while the other revitalized Darkness-type strategies. What no one expected, though, was for these seemingly mismatched Pokemon to join forces in TCG Pocket ’s metagame.

Despite the surprise, the Magnezone-Darkrai ex duo has dominated PvP, becoming the most popular deck shell in tournaments. For players curious about this innovative archetype, this guide will explain how the Magnezone-Darkrai ex meta works and how you can build your own deck to join the action.

How the Magnezone-Darkrai ex Meta Works

Magnezone and Darkrai ex work together seamlessly as damage dealers and snipers. Since Magnezone can evolve from Genetic Apex's Magneton, it charges its attack from the Bench, allowing Darkrai ex to draw all the Energy from the Energy Zone and gradually chip away at the enemy’s HP.

The issue with Darkrai ex decks was the lack of a reliable damage dealer. While Darkness-type Pokemon are strong, they all need to be charged from the Energy Zone. But Darkrai ex is most effective when it can consume all the Energy each turn. So, this made it essential to find a damage dealer that could knock out enemies without using Energy—and that's where Magnezone comes in.

Evolving Magnemite into Genetic Apex's Magneton grants the Ability Volt Charge. Once during your turn, you can take an extra Lightning Energy from your Energy Zone and attach it to Magneton. This allows Magneton to charge itself even if your deck runs only Darkness-type Energy.

In the Magnezone-Darkrai ex meta, you place a tank in the Active Spot and set up Magneton and Darkrai ex on the Bench. Magneton will keep charging itself each turn while you attach Darkness Energy to Darkrai ex, dealing 20 damage per turn. Once Magneton has enough Energy and the enemy’s HP is low enough, you evolve into Magnezone and finish them off.

Magnezone & Darkrai ex Performance Report

  • Tournament appearance : +1,400
  • Win Rate : ~ 57%
  • Metagame Share : ~ 9%

The Magnezone-Darkrai ex shell quickly became the most popular deck in Pokemon TCG Pocket tournaments after its introduction. Currently, the deck—and its variants—boast the highest win rate among other setups and make up nearly 10% of the entire metagame.

The data mentioned above is based on recent Pokemon TCG Pocket tournaments and may change as the metagame evolves.

The Best Magnezone & Darkrai ex Deck Shell

The top deck shell for the Magnezone-Darkrai ex duo is the one supported by Druddigon. When it comes to Supporter Cards, Leaf and Cyrus are essential, while Dawn and Giovanni can also be practical in certain situations. For other Trainer Cards, Giant Cape and Rocky Helmet are solid choices, with the rest of the deck filled with staples like Professor's Research, Pokemon Ball, and Pokemon Communication.

Here's an example of a tournament-winning Magnezone & Darkrai ex deck:

Magnemite

2

Magneton (Genetic Apex)

2

Magnezone

2

Darkrai ex

2

Druddigon

2

Cyrus

1

Leaf

1

Dawn

1

Giant Cape

1

Pokemon Ball

2

Pokemon Communication

2

Professor’s Research

2

The biggest mistake against a Magnezone-Darkrai ex deck is stalling. This archetype thrives on the enemy’s slow plays. To counter it effectively, go for fast-paced decks that can be built quickly and put pressure on the Magnezone-Darkrai ex setup early.

The Rise and Fall of Magnezone-Darkrai ex

Despite its rapid rise to the top of the meta, the Magnezone-Darkrai ex duo is currently struggling against some decks, particularly the refined Exeggutor ex and Celebi ex shell. The addition of Pokemon Communication, Dawn, and Giant Cape to Exeggutor ex decks has made them even more dangerous, especially against cards like Darkrai ex, which are weak to Grass-type Pokemon.

Darkrai ex is also showing strong performance in Greninja decks, which could contribute to Magnezone’s decline in the near future. One of the few remaining advantages for Magnezone is its synergy with Fighting-type Hitmonlee and Marshadow. Otherwise, it could be argued that Magnezone is slowly slipping from the metagame’s top spot.

The Future of Ability-Oriented Decks in Pokemon Pocket

One thing the Magnezone-Darkrai ex phenomenon has highlighted is how most meta Pokemon TCG Pocket decks are vulnerable to Ability damage. This was hinted at by the popularity of Hitmonlee and Greninja and was later triggered by Cyrus' effect. However, we now have clear evidence that building a deck around chip damage from Abilities can truly disrupt the game.

If Pokemon TCG Pocket wants to maintain balanced PvPs, it must introduce better ways to handle damage coming from the enemy’s Bench. Otherwise, the meta could shift toward decks that use the Active Spot solely to stall, finishing off opponents from the Bench—which isn’t the most enjoyable way to play TCG Pocket .

item.title: Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 - How to Get Herb Paris
item.description:
Quick Links

  • How to Get Herb Paris in Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2
  • Where to Buy Herb Paris in Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2
  • Do Herbs Respawn in Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2

Herb Paris is one of the hardest alchemy ingredients to find in the wilderness of Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 . It grows very low to the ground, easily hiding behind bushes and other greenery, making it nearly impossible to spot without knowing exactly where to look.

Unlike most ingredients, the purplish-red color of its flower is of very little help as it’s impossible to see since the Herb doesn’t grow out in the open. Herbalists and Apothecaries stock it quite often, so luckily, players always have a fallback if all else fails.

How to Get Herb Paris in Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2

Wild Herb Paris can be found growing in multiple areas across the world map of KCD 2 . Here are some early game spots:

Herbalist Barnaby’s Garden

Herbalist Barnaby’s Garden can be found north of Trosky Castle (pictured) above. There is a large patch of Herb Paris growing just outside his shack in a fenced-off area.

Stream near Tachov

Directly south of Tachov, there is a small stream flowing south. Head to the location marked in the screenshot above, and you’ll find a large fallen log blocking the middle of the stream. Just to its left, there is a large moss-covered rock and another log. Between the two, there is a patch of green bushes. There are multiple Herb Paris growing underneath the bushes, hidden from view.

Nameless Spring

East of Bozhena’s Meadow and west of Zhelejov, there is a small spring called the Nameless Spring with a basket covered by a white cloth that contains 21 Belladonna and 16 Herb Paris. Head east from Bozhena’s house into the woods to find the stream flowing north. Go upstream (south) until you find its source emerging from a rock. The basket is right next to it.

Traveling on horse can make the journey much faster in KCD 2 . You can find a free horse during the side-quest The Jaunt.

Where to Buy Herb Paris in Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2

Herb Paris can be purchased from most Herbalists or Apothecaries in KCD 2 .

  • Apothecary Emerich: The first Apothecary is named Apothecary Emerich, who can be found in Troskowitz , the town you end up in at the very start of the game. You will find Emerich’s shop west of town, next to a large herb garden. During the day, he can be found on the second floor, accessible from the stairs outside the building. Unfortunately, he does not sell any fresh ingredients, only dried ones, including Herb Paris.
  • Herbalist Barnaby: Herbalist Barnaby stocks fresh Herb Paris. He can be found north of Trosky Castle .

Do Herbs Respawn in Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2

Yes, Herbs regrow in KCD 2 . Typically, this takes roughly a week or so of in-game time, sometimes less. Make sure you’re not staying in the same location as where the herbs are supposed to grow to avoid getting in the way.

item.title: Genshin Impact Players Want Changes to Current Banner System
item.description:
Summary

  • Players want a change to Limited Character Banner for more variety and frequent re-runs.
  • Proposal to increase featured characters from 2 to 3 per update for better player experience.
  • Fans suggest a triple banner mechanic like Honkai: Star Rail to address power creep.

Genshin Impact players want to see a major change to the Limited Character Banner, which is widely regarded as the main banner in the game. This banner is the primary source of revenue for Genshin Impact , as it's the only one that features new five-star characters, who take center stage in each new update.

Since the addition of the Natlan region, Genshin Impact has been introducing at least two new characters in each update, with Mavuika, Citlali, and Lan Yan being the most recent additions in Version 5.4. However, this pattern will be broken in the next update, as HoYoverse will introduce only one new playable unit, the five-star Anemo user Yumemizuki Mizuki.

Once a character's release banner ends, Genshin Impact players must wait for a re-run, which usually arrives 5–6 months later. As the pool of playable characters continues to expand, it has become much harder for Genshin Impact to frequently give re-runs to older characters. Over the last couple of months, many fans have complained that some of their favorite characters have not made an appearance for over 10 consecutive updates. Currently, Genshin Impact 's double-banner gacha mechanic allows HoYoverse to feature four characters per update, two for each banner cycle. A Reddit user named keiosKnivesALot has proposed a simple solution to this problem: increasing the number of featured characters per cycle from two to three. This change would allow the game to introduce re-runs much more frequently.

Genshin Impact Players Want New Tripple Banner Mechanic

The double-banner mechanic was introduced for a similar reason and was implemented during the first half of the Inazuma arc. Since then, three new major regions have arrived, and the roster has grown significantly. Many fans agree that Genshin Impact 's Chronicled Wish is a step in the right direction, as it allows players to pull for some of the game's oldest characters.

However, the Chronicled Banner did not address the issue that some characters, like Kokomi, have already missed 14 consecutive updates. Kokomi's last banner appearance was during update 3.8, and her re-run banner was released at the end of July 2023. A couple of comments have pointed out that Genshin Impact should take inspiration from Honkai: Star Rail , which featured a new character in the first part of the update and three re-runs in the second.

Some fans, however, have noted that power creep is a much larger issue in Honkai: Star Rail , which is likely why there was a greater need for a triple banner. HoYoverse has yet to provide any official information about plans to increase the number of limited five-star characters featured in each update. It would not be surprising if this mechanic were added, considering that double banners were introduced for similar reasons.
